organization who can do this job as well as you are doing it. I regret
very much that it has become such a terrific responsibility that you
have been driven to the point which your letter suggests. I shall, how¬
ever, be extremely disappointed in you as a person, as well as being
disappointed for the organization, if there is any more suggestion that
you would like to get out.
My kindest, my fondest, and my best always.
Sincerely,
Graydon Ausmus, Director
Radio Broadcasting Services
